snippet: The satisfaction level had already been low by historical standards in recent polls.
abstract: Public satisfaction with the Supreme Court, which had already been low by historical standards in recent polls, dropped further in the wake of the court’s 5-to-4 ruling upholding the Affordable Care Act; with only 41 percent of Americans now saying they approve of the job the court is doing.

byline.original: By ADAM LIPTAK and ALLISON KOPICKI
byline.contributor: Adam Liptak reported from Washington, and Allison Kopicki from New York. Dalia Sussman contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The satisfaction level had already been low by historical standards in recent polls.

headline.main: Public’s Opinion of Supreme Court Drops After Health Care Law Decision
headline.print_headline: Public’s Opinion of Supreme Court Drops After Health Care Law Decision

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
